thread.title: Retail therapy: Brunswick's Bonnie and Neil create gorgeous art, screen prints and textiles
thread.title_full: Retail therapy: Brunswick's Bonnie and Neil create gorgeous art, screen prints and textiles

author: Justine Costigan
title: Retail therapy: Brunswick's Bonnie and Neil create gorgeous art, screen prints and textiles
text:
Bonnie and Neil's new store in Brunswick. Photo: Supplied 
Bonnie Ashley and Neil Downie's Bonnie and Neil's homewares label now has a home.  The showroom, which opened in September, is tucked down a residential street in Brunswick and sits in front of their studio, where large windows provide a front-row seat to the practical business of screen-printing.
Bonnie and Neil's textiles, including tea towels, tablecloths, napkins, table runners and cushions in bright colours and intricate patterns have been a favourite of interior designers since the pair launched in Melbourne in 2010, and the showroom allows them to showcase their range in a proper setting. Their hand-printed wall tiles, limited edition art, and textiles sit beautifully with furniture by Grazia and Co – upholstered in Bonnie and Neil fabric – sculptures by Rob Bast, and Robert Gordon ceramics, featuring Bonnie and Neil's own designs.
That Ashley once worked as  a florist comes as no surprise: not only is the studio decorated with dramatic displays of flowers but floral themes work their way into many of the label's textiles, as a range of framed prints and on Robert Gordon's ceramics. 
If an out-of-the-way Brunswick location is a deterrent, check out their Instagram account, where stunning images of the showroom and their products should be enough to convince you to make a beeline for this lovely store.
Advertisement Bonnie and Neil is at 121A Donald Street, Brunswick, 9384 2234. Open Thursday to Saturday 9.30am-5pm or by appointment. bonnieandneil.com.au . Instagram @bonnieandneil
